channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15938] position alias in order by fails for union queries
item.description: The problem is that the query introduces a spurious ALLCOLREF
item.summary: position alias in order by fails for union queries

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Preliminary patch, may need some cleanup. Also need to see if it breaks tests.
I was actually considering explicitly setting aliases for all SELEXPR right after parse, if not set, to avoid this problem at any later point. But for now this is it.
ashutoshc can you take a look?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12852963/HIVE-15938.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12852963 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
seems like test for union-all + view is failing.

Yeah, there's some weird issue with subqueries with union... the SA thinks newly added column names are ambiguous with something even though there's only one level and there was no ambiguity before. Looking.
Woops, actually the replacement code is completely screwed, creating ambiguous nodes.
A patch that fixes a number of issues.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12853165/HIVE-15938.01.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12853320 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Failed -ve test looks related.
pxiong Can you help review this?

No, they are not related actually. I see they were failing for a while, e.g. https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/3632/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestNegativeCliDriver/testCliDriver_create_external_acid_/history/
create_view_failure has age 1. Likely related.

Revert the out file change for union10.
Data size estimate changed for constprog test, without a change of number of rows. The AST only changes as expected (allcolref -> single col), so if anything it's an unrelated issue in estimation.

ashutoshc it failed in 10s of the previous builds except one. It may have been the patch that fixed it that is not merged yet https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/3632/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli/TestNegativeCliDriver/testCliDriver_create_view_failure2_/history/
LGTM. pxiong Can you please also take a look?

Thanks for sershe's efforts. The patch LGTM. I just have one doubt. If you try, you will find out that postgres actually supports select * from t order by 1. I am thinking that after HIVE-15160, supporting order by number in select * would be straight forward.
